snippet: A federal court on Friday ruled that the health care law’s mandate that employers provide free coverage for contraception infringed on individual religious liberty.
abstract: Federal court rules in case Gilardi v the Department of Health and Human Services that health care law’s mandate that employers provide free coverage for contraception infringes on individual religious liberty; ruling, largely in line with most others around the country so far, is latest setback for Obama administration as it struggles to fix crippled federal health care Web site.
lead_paragraph: A federal court on Friday ruled that the health care law’s mandate that employers provide free coverage for contraception infringed on individual religious liberty.

headline.main: Court Rules Contraception Mandate Infringes on Religious Freedom
headline.print_headline: Court Rules Contraception Mandate Infringes on Religious Freedom

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
